title.narrative: Mithila Women Empowerment and Sustainable Livestock Program

description.narrative: This project will be implemented in the district of Madhubani in the Indian state of Bihar. A total of 366 families will participate (122 original and 244 Pass on the Gift). This project will support seven women’s self-help groups (SHGs) in seven villages. These groups engage in savings and credit activities and save up to half a dollar per month. These women are usually the de facto head of their families, because most of the men migrate to cities in search of work, staying away from home for three to six months. In this project, 69 original families will be provided with one cow each; 53 families with two goats each; and one buck will be provided to each of the goat-rearing groups. All original families will be given lactating or pregnant animals so that these families will benefit and save money at an early stage. The original placements will also include vegetable and fodder seeds/seedlings. Training will be provided in Heifer’s 12 Cornerstones, SHG management, improved animal management, gender issues, kitchen gardening and fodder production. Participants will also learn about human health and hygiene to improve their health and nutrition. These families will also be trained in how to reduce their risks and mitigate the effects of the floods and droughts that plague the region. With the support of the local veterinary department, services will be provided to the families for the proper management of animals. Among the group members, women will be identified and trained as Community Animal Health Workers (CAHWs) and Community Facilitators (CFs) from the local areas. These CAHWs and CFs will receive intensive trainings to develop their skills and knowledge, since they plan critical roles in ensuring the long-term sustainability of the project.
